article.headline: Harvard 72, Central Connecticut 65
article.story: NEW BRITAIN, Conn. (AP) -- Evan Harris scored 20 points to help Harvard rally from an 18-point deficit and beat Central Connecticut 72-65 Thursday night. The Crimson (6-4) trailed for most of the first half and were down by six at the break. They used a 19-6 run capped by an Andrew Pusar breakaway bucket with 9:22 left in the game to take a 52-50 lead. Harris took over after that, scoring five straight points to give the Crimson their biggest lead, 61-56, with 5:37 remaining. The Blue Devils (3-7) were unable to mount much of a rally down the stretch. A 3-pointer by Harvard's Drew Housman with 58 seconds extended the Crimson lead to seven, helping seal the victory. Joe Seymore, who had five 3-pointers in the first half, and Obie Nwadike led the Blue Devils with 15 points apiece.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
